fi.left2die.gamestates
Class OptionState

java.lang.Object
  org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState
      fi.left2die.gamestates.OptionState
All Implemented Interfaces:
Button.ButtonListener, Slider.SliderListener, org.newdawn.slick.ControlledInputReciever, org.newdawn.slick.ControllerListener, org.newdawn.slick.InputListener, org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener, org.newdawn.slick.MouseListener, org.newdawn.slick.state.GameState
public class OptionState
extends org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState
implements Button.ButtonListener, Slider.SliderListener

OptionState is a game state where user can change setting like key setting, and sound music volume.

Author:
TeeMuki

                         int x,
                         int y)

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(int key,
                       char c)
Event occurs when key is pressed, it iterates trough each selector and look for active ones. If selector is active it binds pressed key to the selector.

Specified by:
keyPressed in interface org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener
Overrides:
